attributes.action: Protect the right to jury trials for all eligible criminal offences
attributes.additional_details: Reports of plans to restrict jury trials threaten a core constitutional safeguard. Trial by jury protects the rule of law, limits state power and keeps justice in the hands of the people. Removing it would dismantle a centuries old protection and weaken public confidence. The backlog comes from years of under funding, not juries. Parliament must act now to defend this essential right.
attributes.background: Trial by jury is a constitutional safeguard that defends our rights and limits government power. The rule of law depends on it. Parliament must reject any plan to weaken jury trials and require the Government to protect them in full.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Do not remove trial by jury for certain cases
